name: Peach Buttermilk Soup
description: I like to eat this creamy soup for breakfast. It is almost like a lassi, the popular Indian milkshake-like drink. Make sure your peaches are ripe and juicy.
keywords: buttermilk, peach, dessert, gluten-free, halal, healthy, kosher, low cholesterol, low-sodium, vegetarian, summer
recipeIngredient: 2 to 3 tablespoons mild flavored honey, such as clover or acacia (to taste)
2 to 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice (to taste)
1/2 teaspoon almond extract or vanilla extract

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Fill a large bowl with ice water. Drop the peaches into the boiling water, blanch for 20 seconds, then transfer to the ice water. Peel, cut in half, remove the pits, and set 2 large or 3 small peaches aside.

Place the remaining peaches in a blender with the honey, lemon juice and 1 cup of the buttermilk (you will probably have to work in batches) and blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and whisk in the remaining buttermilk, the almond or vanilla extract, and the spices. Taste and adjust seasonings.
Slice or dice the peaches you set aside and stir into the soup. Cover and refrigerate for one hour or longer. Ladle into bowls and garnish each serving with slivered almonds.
